Class ProjectDetails

java.lang.Object
ProjectDetails
public class ProjectDetails extends Object
Reads and writes to files and creates lists of objects using the data.

Reading from files:
reads from files "All projects.txt" and generates a list of objects under the 'Project' class.

Writing to files:
Takes all the information stored in the list and writes all the information to "All projects.txt", "Completed projects.txt", "customerContacts.txt", "contractorContacts.txt" and the "architectContacts.txt" files.

Version:
4.0, 25/09/2022
Author:
Ifekharul Islam

  • Constructor Details

    • ProjectDetails

      public ProjectDetails(ArrayList<Person> contactList)
      Constructs 3 list of 'Person' objects.

      The 3 lists are separated into the customer, contractor and the architect.

      Parameters:
      contactList - list of objects that holds details of all individuals.
      See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getProjList

      public ArrayList<Project> getProjList()
      Returns the list of generated Project object.
      Returns:
      the list of Project objects.

    • addToList

      public void addToList(Project newProj)
      Adds received objects to the projList.
      Parameters:
      newProj - new object to be added to the list.

    • setProjList

      public void setProjList()
      Reads from the 'poisedpms' database, queries the table 'proj_data' with 'proj_fee', 'finalised_projs' and 'proj_contacts' joined together. and uses the content to create objects of 'Project' and appends to an arrayList.
      See Also:
      • Project
      • getObject(ArrayList, String)

    • getObject

      public Person getObject(ArrayList<Person> objList, String name)
      Takes a list of Person objects and compares each elements name to a sent string. Returns the object that matches the string.
      Parameters:
      objList - List of 'Person' objects.
      name - string to compare.
      Returns:
      object that matches the string value of 'name' or null in not matched.
      See Also:
      • Person
      • Person.getName()
